required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Vaginal Hygiene Wash as Adjunct Treatment in Bacterial Vaginosis
clinical_study.official_title: The Effectiveness of Vaginal Hygiene Wash as Adjunct Treatment in Bacterial Vaginosis- a Randomized Double Blind Controlled Trial With Microbial Analysis

brief_summary.textblock: This study compares the effect of vaginal hygiene wash versus placebo as adjunct treatment with oral metronidazole in treatment of women with bacterial vaginosis

detailed_description.textblock: This is a randomized controlled trial comparing the trial hygiene wash against placebo wash as adjunct treatment with oral metronidazole in women with bacterial vaginosis, with microbial analysis of vaginal flora compared to healthy control women

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: hygiene wash plus antibiotic, placebo wash plus antibiotic
study_design_info.masking_description: the trial hygiene wash and placebo wash are labelled A or B in identical packaging by manufacturer's company and blinded from both participants and investigators and only revealed at the end of data completion

primary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants who have negative bacterial vaginosis (BV) blue test after completed treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Visual analog scale of symptoms before treatment
primary_outcome.description: self-evaluation of symptom using Visual analog scale (VAS) scale 0 to 10 based on questionnaire, 5 symptoms assessed are 1) level of comfort in the genital region, 2) malodorous external genitalia, 3) comfort in sexual intercourse, 4) satisfaction regarding intimate hygiene, and 5) self-esteem

primary_outcome.measure: Visual analog scale of symptoms after treatment
primary_outcome.description: self-evaluation of symptom using Visual analog scale (VAS) scale 0 to 10 based on questionnaire, 5 symptoms assessed are 1) level of comfort in the genital region, 2) malodorous external genitalia, 3) comfort in sexual intercourse, 4) satisfaction regarding intimate hygiene, and 5) self-esteem

primary_outcome.measure: Microbial profile of vaginal flora before treatment
primary_outcome.description: DNA quantitative polymerase chain reaction (qPCR) array analysis of vaginal swab taken before treatment which includes Lactobacillus, Gardnerella, Prevotella, Candida, and Trichomonas vaginalis

primary_outcome.measure: Microbial profile of vaginal flora after treatment
primary_outcome.description: DNA quantitative polymerase chain reaction (qPCR) array analysis of vaginal swab taken before treatment which includes Lactobacillus, Gardnerella, Prevotella, Candida, and Trichomonas vaginalis
Concentration of cytokines (interleukins (IL-6, IL-8, IL-10), tumor necrosis factor (TNF-alpha) all in pg/mL at baseline
Concentration of cytokines (interleukins (IL-6, IL-8, IL-10), tumor necrosis factor (TNF-alpha) all in pg/ml after completed treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Recurrence of symptoms 1 month after completed treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Self-rated symptoms using visual analog scale (VAS) scale 0 to 10 based on questionnaire, 5 symptoms assessed are 1) level of comfort in the genital region, 2) malodorous external genitalia, 3) comfort in sexual intercourse, 4) satisfaction regarding intimate hygiene, and 5) self-esteem

secondary_outcome.measure: Microbial analysis of vaginal flora 1 month after completed treatment
secondary_outcome.description: DNA quantitative polymerase chain reaction (qPCR) array analysis of vaginal swab taken before treatment which includes Lactobacillus, Gardnerella, Prevotella, Candida, and Trichomonas vaginalis

arm_group.description: Hygiene wash once daily at night for two weeks plus oral metronidazole 400mg three times daily for 1 week
Placebo wash once daily at night for two weeks plus oral metronidazole 400mg three times daily for 1 week
Asymptomatic healthy women with BV negative test

intervention.description: vaginal hygiene wash containing Propylene Glycol, Ethylhexylglycerin, Lactic Acid, Sodium Pyrrolidone Carboxylic Acid, Alpha-Glucan Oligosaccharide, Lactococcus Ferment Lysate, Octenidine Hydrochloride plus all other ingredients in placebo wash

placebo wash containing water, disodium cocoamphodiacetate, sodium chloride, sodium glycolate, acrylates copolymer, potassium laureate phosphate, tripotassium phosphate, laurel glucoside, lauramidopropyl hydroxysultaine, disulfonate de sodium, Polyethylene glycol (PEG)-120 Methyl Glucose Trioleate, Propanediol, Glycol distearate, Laureth-4, Cocamidopropyl betaine, Potassium Lactate, Caprylyl Glycol, Disodium ethylenediaminetetraacetic acid (EDTA), Potassium Hydroxide, and Perfume

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 1. premenopausal women who are sexually active 2.willing to use hygiene wash together with prescribed oral antibiotics 3. able to undergo pelvic examination for sampling of vaginal discharge
Exclusion Criteria:
- 1. Unable to comply with pelvic examination or hygiene wash 2. Concurrent use of hormonal treatment or antibiotic therapy 3. Intrauterine device either copper or levonorgestrel-releasing system 4. Women with known diabetes mellitus 5. Pregnant women

reference.citation: Lamont RF, Sobel JD, Akins RA, Hassan SS, Chaiworapongsa T, Kusanovic JP, Romero R. The vaginal microbiome: new information about genital tract flora using molecular based techniques. BJOG. 2011 Apr;118(5):533-49. doi: 10.1111/j.1471-0528.2010.02840.x. Epub 2011 Jan 20. Review.

Bai G, Gajer P, Nandy M, Ma B, Yang H, Sakamoto J, Blanchard MH, Ravel J, Brotman RM. Comparison of storage conditions for human vaginal microbiome studies. PLoS One. 2012;7(5):e36934. doi: 10.1371/journal.pone.0036934. Epub 2012 May 24.

Hallmaier-Wacker LK, Lueert S, Roos C, Knauf S. The impact of storage buffer, DNA extraction method, and polymerase on microbial analysis. Sci Rep. 2018 Apr 19;8(1):6292. doi: 10.1038/s41598-018-24573-y.

results_reference.citation: Russo R, Edu A, De Seta F. Study on the effects of an oral lactobacilli and lactoferrin complex in women with intermediate vaginal microbiota. Arch Gynecol Obstet. 2018 Jul;298(1):139-145. doi: 10.1007/s00404-018-4771-z. Epub 2018 Apr 10.

patient_data.ipd_description: clinical data sheet containing demographics, data collection (VAS score of symptoms, BV blue test)
